intro: Oriastrum stuebelii var. argentinum, commonly known as the Argentine tansy, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-green foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a fibrous root system and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
